1.text: Find out when to plant garlic in your region.

2.text: Choose a planting spot and prepare the soil.

4.text: Break the cloves from a fresh garlic head.

5.text: Push each clove into the soil.

6.text: Cover the planted cloves with mulch.

7.text: Fertilize the cloves or top-dress with compost.

11.text: Note the signs of readiness for harvesting.

12.text: Loosen the area around each bulb with a shovel or garden fork.

13.text: Store garlic in a cool, dry place in your home to prevent them from going bad.

14.text: Make a garlic plait or braid.

15.text: Store garlic in oil or vinegar.
